pr_title: Rename accumulator to processor to match Go

timeline.message:
Rename accumulator to processor to match Go

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Drutu <bogdandrutu@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I was following this rename until I hit this. Why are we passing a processor to create a new binding for an instrument? That doesn't seem like the role of the processor to me. I could think that the binding would be registered with the accumulator, not the processor.
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Actually I need to pass only an Aggregator you can see that all the Bound constructor just call getAggregator. I decided to do that immediately after #2257.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: this definitely doesn't feel right to me. The Accumulator should be handling the binding, so it can keep track of when to released the resources associated with the labelset. I don't think that's the job of the Processor, which needs to hold long-term state of all the labelsets against which recordings have been made, even if they're not currently being actively recorded.
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: It is not, as explained in the other comment. I think you are keep reviewing this.
replies.author: bogdandrutu
